aboutSection.title: LEARN MORE ABOUT OÁSIS
aboutSection.subTitle: We are a non-profit organization dedicated to <purple>transforming</purple> communities through accessible education and sustainable development, guided by <purple>Christian</purple> principles.

item1.title: What is the main purpose of our organization?
item1.subTitle: Our purpose is to offer hope and opportunities to children in vulnerable situations, empowering them through knowledge and faith for a better future.

helpSection.subTitle: While the world moves forward, they are left behind…
helpSection.descriptionP1: As the world advances in technology and comfort, hundreds of children in Bantandja, Guinea-Bissau, face life without the BASICS: no school, no regular meals, no structure, and no hope for the future.
helpSection.descriptionP2: In a village where over 70% of the population is illiterate and most survive on less than $15 a month: <purple> WE HAVE CHOSEN TO BECOME PART OF THE SOLUTION.</purple>

item1.title: Education
item1.subTitle: Your financial support today will make a difference in the future of the children benefiting from the school and will impact their entire nation.

learnSection.subTitle: With joy and a deep sense of mission, we are launching a campaign to raise €10,000 with ONE CLEAR GOAL: to open the first classroom of the Good Samaritan School this September, initially serving 40 children.

section1.title: MEET OUR FIRST PARTNER PROJECT
section1.description: Our first partner project begins in <purple>Bantandja</purple>, a small village in the far east of Guinea-Bissau, with around 646 inhabitants.
section1.description2: The community faces a harsh reality: <purple>over 70% illiteracy</purple>, monthly <purple>incomes below $15</purple>, <purple>food insecurity, and an almost complete lack of basic infrastructure</purple> such as schools and healthcare.
section1.description3: To transform this reality, we are launching the <purple>Good Samaritan School</purple> — a space that, in its first phase, will include a <purple>classroom for 40 children</purple>, offering quality education, daily meals, and a safe environment.

section2.title: STAGES OF THE BOM SAMARITAN SCHOOL

item1.title: Fundraising
item1.description:
Fundraising Campaign for Construction: 50,000€: ~R$318,595.92
  • Sound system for the classrooms
  • Construction of kitchen, cafeteria, bathrooms, and teachers' house
  • Artesian well for water supply
  • Purchase of furniture, including tables, chairs, cabinets, stove, refrigerator
  • Installation of solar panels for sustainable energy supply
  • Protective wall around the school

item2.title: Construction of School Infrastructure
item2.description: Build and equip the school to meet the needs of the children in the Bantaja region, from hiring local construction teams to overseeing the progress of the work to ensure quality and safety.

item3.title: Recruitment of Teachers
item3.description: Ensure a qualified team of teachers, aligned with the values and vision of Oasis, as well as validated by the Guinean educational curriculum.

item4.title: Admission of Students
item4.description: Admission of 150 children to the school in two shifts (morning and afternoon) starting with a screening process to ensure the inclusion of children in situations of greater vulnerability.

item5.title: Official Opening of the School
item5.description: Celebration of the school's inauguration with the local community, conducting continuous monitoring of the school's operations. A key focus on ensuring students receive meals during school hours.

item6.title: Sustainability of the Project
item6.description: Launch of the 'Educate a Child' campaign, where supporters contribute monthly to maintain a student's education and to expand the school, reaching more members of the community.

3.description: Ensure a qualified team of teachers aligned with the values and vision of Oasis as also validated by the Guinean educational curriculum.

4.description: Admission of 150 children at the school in two shifts (morning and afternoon) from a screening to ensure inclusion of children in vulnerable situations.

6.title: Project Sustainability
6.description: Launch of the 'Educate a child' campaign, where supporters contribute monthly to maintain one student and expand the school to serve more communities.

section4.title: 10K Goal: The Classroom that will Change Everything
section4.description: We are running a fundraising campaign with a goal of €10,000 to take the <purple>first concrete steps</purple> in establishing a school in Bantandja. This amount will allow us to begin transforming the reality of Bantandja by ensuring:
section4.description1: <purple>Accountability is a key part of our commitment.</purple> Every resource will be used with responsibility and transparency, because we believe integrity also teaches.
section4.description2: <purple>The classroom will be built. The children will learn. And you can be part of it!</purple>

item1.title: Who We Are
item1.description: <purple>Oasis</purple> is a nonprofit organization guided by Christian principles, committed to transforming communities through accessible education and sustainable development.

item2.title: Our Vision
item2.description: <purple>Our purpose</purple> is to break generational cycles of poverty by offering hope and real opportunities to vulnerable children.

item3.title: Our Mission
item3.description: <purple>We believe</purple> every child has the right to LEARN, GROW, and DREAM of a different future.

item1.title: Hope
item1.description: We nourish hope by offering tangible opportunities for growth, stability, and a renewed sense of possibility.

item2.title: Faith
item2.description: We believe in a firm trust in God, guiding our actions with integrity, compassion, and humility.

item3.title: Transformation
item3.description: We believe in the transformative power of education to equip individuals with the tools and confidence needed to shape their destinies and contribute positively to society.
